bibCreator

Class BibCreator

  • java.lang.Object
    • bibCreator.BibCreator

  • public class BibCreator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class reads any amount of JSON formatted files (for example, .bib files) from a folder (specify path at inputFolder) and creates three corresponding output files for each input file with these respective formats: IEEE, ACM, NJ. For example, a Latex1.bib input file containing one or more articles will be opened, read, and then processed to create the corresponding IEEE1.json, ACM1.json, NJ1.json formatted output files.

    Note: Input files containing empty fields are processed until the first occurence of empty field, then they are deleted.

    Since:
    2018-03-12
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jeremiah Tiongson, Yun Shi

    • Method Detail

      • processFilesForValidation

        public static void processFilesForValidation(java.util.Scanner[] sc,
                                             java.io.File[] files,
                                             java.io.PrintWriter[] pwIEE,
                                             java.io.PrintWriter[] pwACM,
                                             java.io.PrintWriter[] pwNJ,
                                             java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> badOutputList)
        TASK 5: This method processes an array of opened input files one by one using a for loop. The outer while loop reads the file at index i until it has no more lines. The inner while loop is entered when an article is found. When a closing curly brace is found, the inner while loop is broken. If an article contains an empty field, the outerloop is broken and we are back to the for loop to process the next file.
        Parameters:
        sc - Array of Scanners representing opened files which will be processed for validation
        files - Passed as a parameter for processInvalid method
        pwIEE - Writes to IEEE formatted output files
        pwACM - Writes to ACM formatted output files
        pwNJ - Writes to NJ formatted output files
        badOutputList - Keeps track of indexes of invalid files that will eventually be deleted

      • processInvalid

        public static void processInvalid(java.io.File[] inputFiles,
                                  java.lang.String field,
                                  int index,
                                  java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> badOutputList)
        This method processes an invalid input file, taking its index and adding it to the List of Integers badOutputlist.
        Parameters:
        inputFiles - Used to display the name of the invalid input file
        field - Used to display the invalid field
        index - Stored in the badOutputlist
        badOutputList - the bad output list
        Throws:
        Throws - FileInvalidException and displays the error message indicating the corresponding invalid input file

      • parse

        public static java.lang.String parse(java.lang.String s)
        This methods parses a line into the content of the field by using the String methods indexOf and substring.
        Parameters:
        s - The line that needs to be parsed
        Returns:
        The content of the field

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
